original: Hylander, Ivar, teol. dr, domprost, Växjö, f. 24/7/00 i Norrköp. av överlär. Johan H. o. Hilda Diderichsen. G. 35 m. Elisabeth Matton. Barn: Siv f. 37, Bengt 39. — Teol. fil. ex. i Upps. 20, fil. kand. 25, teol. kand. 29, teol. lic. 31, teol. dr 32, stud. i Oslo o. Göttingen, doc. i Gamla testam. exeget. 32-39, prästv. 32. Lär. v. Sigtunastift. hum. lärov. 32-35, tf. förest, v. lekniannask. i Sigtuna 35-36, sekr. i Diakonisityr. skriftutsk. o. litt :che,f i Diakonistyr. Bokförlag 38-39, kyrkoh. i Norrköp. S:t Olai förs. 39, domprost 0. kyrkoh. i Växjö o. Öjaby sed. 43. Ordf. i Upps. stud:kår 33-34, v. ordf. i Sv :es fö ren. stud: kårer 34, ordf. i Sv:es kristl. gymn:rör. 36-39, led. av kyrkond i Norrköp. 40-43, suppl. i ASP centr:styr. f. 319, suppl. i Linköp. domkap. 40-43, insp. f. Norrköp. h. a. 1. 41-43, hed:led. av Ostgöta nat. i Upps., led. av Pro fide et christianis-mo. Skr.: Der litter. Samuel-Saul-Komplex traditionsgesch. untersucht (grad:avh. 32), Gamla testam. psalmbok (37), Det omistliga (predikn. 43), upps. i exeget., kyrkl. o. relig. tidskr. o. pubk, ut g. Acta Ostrogothioa I (25) o. III (35), red. av Sv. Kyrkotidn. o. Ny Kyrkl. Tidskr. 37-41, Sv. Kyrkans Årsbok 38-39. Sign. 1. H. LNO.
translated: Hylander, Ivar, Doctor of Theology, Cathedral Provost, Växjö, born on July 24, 1900 in Norrköping, to senior teacher Johan H. and Hilda Diderichsen. Married in 1935 to Elisabeth Matton. They have two children, Siv born in 1937, and Bengt in 1939. He obtained a bachelor's degree in Theology in 1920 and a bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1925 at Uppsala University, followed by a master's degree in theology in 1929, a licentiate in theology in 1931, and a doctorate in theology in 1932. He studied in Oslo and Göttingen, and was a lecturer in Old Testament exegesis from 1932 until 1939, and an ordained minister in 1932. He taught at Sigtuna Foundation from 1932 until 1935, and acted as the temporary head of the lay seminary in Sigtuna from 1935 until 1936. He was the secretary of the Diaconal Literature Committee and Diaconate Book Publishers from 1938 until 1939, a parish priest in Norrköping at St. Olai Church from 1939, and a Cathedral Provost and parish priest in Växjö and Öjaby since 1943. He was the chairman of the Uppsala Student Union in 1933-1934, deputy chairman of the Swedish Confederation of Student Unions in 1934, chairman of the Swedish Christian Gymnastics Association in 1936-1939. He was a member of the board of the Norrköping Church from 1940 until 1943, substitute member of the ASP Central Board since 1939, substitute member of the Linköping Cathedral Chapter from 1940 until 1943, and inspector of Norrköping high schools from 1941 until 1943. He was an honorary member of the Östergötland Society of Natural Sciences in Uppsala and a member of Pro fide et christianismo. His works include: "The Literary Samuel-Saul Complex Traditionshesch. Examined" (dissertation, 1932), "Old Testament Hymnal" (1937), "The Unavoidable" (sermon, 1943), and articles in exegetical, ecclesiastical, and religious journals and publications, published in "Acta Ostrogothioa I" (1925) and III (1935). He was also the editor of Svenska Kyrkotidn. and Ny Kyrkl. Tidskr. (1937-1941) and Svenska Kyrkans Årsbok (1938-1939). His signature is 1.H.LNO.

structured.name: Ivar Hylander
structured.description: Ivar Hylander was a Swedish Doctor of Theology and Cathedral Provost in Växjö. He was born on July 24, 1900, in Norrköping, to senior teacher Johan H. Hylander and Hilda Diderichsen. He obtained a bachelor's degree in Theology in 1920 and a bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1925 at Uppsala University, followed by a master's degree in theology in 1929, a licentiate in theology in 1931, and a doctorate in theology in 1932. He studied in Oslo and Göttingen, and was a lecturer in Old Testament exegesis from 1932 until 1939, and an ordained minister in 1932. He taught at Sigtuna Foundation from 1932 until 1935, and acted as the temporary head of the lay seminary in Sigtuna from 1935 until 1936. He was the secretary of the Diaconal Literature Committee and Diaconate Book Publishers from 1938 until 1939, a parish priest in Norrköping at St. Olai Church from 1939, and a Cathedral Provost and parish priest in Växjö and Öjaby since 1943. He was the chairman of the Uppsala Student Union in 1933-1934, deputy chairman of the Swedish Confederation of Student Unions in 1934, chairman of the Swedish Christian Gymnastics Association in 1936-1939. He was a member of the board of the Norrköping Church from 1940 until 1943, substitute member of the ASP Central Board since 1939, substitute member of the Linköping Cathedral Chapter from 1940 until 1943, and inspector of Norrköping high schools from 1941 until 1943. He was an honorary member of the Östergötland Society of Natural Sciences in Uppsala and a member of Pro fide et christianismo. His works include: "The Literary Samuel-Saul Complex Traditionshesch. Examined" (dissertation, 1932), "Old Testament Hymnal" (1937), "The Unavoidable" (sermon, 1943), and articles in exegetical, ecclesiastical, and religious journals and publications, published in "Acta Ostrogothioa I" (1925) and III (1935). He was also the editor of Svenska Kyrkotidn. and Ny Kyrkl. Tidskr. (1937-1941) and Svenska Kyrkans Årsbok (1938-1939). His signature is 1.H.LNO.
